TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F Austin to James F Perry, 01-01-1830

barker_notes.barker_summary: Austin to James F. Perry, January 1, 1830. Urging him to move to Texas.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 311-312

*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to James F. Perry, January 1, 1830. Urging him to move to Texas.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Austin*/location_mentioned*,*date_mentioned n="01-01-1830"> Jany. 1, 1830*/date_mentioned*.*/p* *p*My dear *person_mentioned*brother */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*sister*/person_mentioned*,*/p*
*p*I have taken a few moments of Leisure to present to you my sincere wishes that the *date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1830">new year */date_mentioned*which has just entered may be a happy and prosperous one to you and that before its close we may all be united once more in this *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*I wrote you *date_mentioned n="12-xx-1829">last month*/date_mentioned* advising and urging you to remove here as soon as possible. I again repeat the same, I wrote you that I had petitioned for *location_mentioned*land */location_mentioned*for you I have asked of the Govt *location_mentioned*eleven Leagues of land*/location_mentioned* for you on the condition that you remove here. My *person_mentioned*friends */person_mentioned*are of the opinion the whole Eleven Leagues will be granted which will be near 50,000 acres. The land I have selected for you *location_mentioned*lies on Galveston Bay and within six miles of Galveston harbor*/location_mentioned*. if land is ever worth anything, one single league at that *location_mentioned*place */location_mentioned*will be worth a fortune. I cannot say positively that the whole *location_mentioned*Eleven Leagues*/location_mentioned* will be granted, but I have no doubt that at least five will be. I shall know the final result in *date_mentioned n="03-xx-1830">two months*/date_mentioned* and inform you.*/p*
*p*There is an opening here now for *person_mentioned*merchandising*/person_mentioned*. Goods can be brought in free of duty until *date_mentioned n="11-xx-1830">November next*/date_mentioned*, and if you have an idea of removing here you ought to come immediately so as to bring in a large assortment of goods before the time expires for free importations.*/p*
*p*I am very desirous for you to remove and there now cannot be a doubt remaining [as] to the rapid rise of this *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*. [I can] do something for you now, and you must come in time. If the *person_mentioned*Govr*/person_mentioned* grants the land I have asked, the title will be void unless you remove at least within 18 months from this time but if you delay untill after *date_mentioned n="11-xx-1830">Novr */date_mentioned*you will have to pay heavy duties on every thing you bring.*/p*
*p*You may be sure that I would not urge your removal in so positive a manner if I was not convinced that you will be greatly benifited. There is no time for hesitation or delay. You will find us a plain set of *person_mentioned*people*/person_mentioned*, and you need not be at much expense to bring furniture.*/p*
*p*Farewell and let me hear from you as quick as possible.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin.*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p*Direct your letter post paid to the care of *person_mentioned*James W. Breedlove */person_mentioned**location_mentioned*New Orleans*/location_mentioned*, and if you wish for any information relative to vessels coming to this *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*write to *person_mentioned*Breedlove*/person_mentioned*, also if you wish to send anything here, consign it to him with instructions to ship it to the care of *person_mentioned*John Austin */person_mentioned**location_mentioned*Brazoria*/location_mentioned*. *person_mentioned*Breedlove */person_mentioned*does most of the business of this *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*and I wish you to give him yours if you come here, and you must come and that immediately.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned*.*/p* *p*Bring all kinds of fruit seed and a quantity of it*/p*
*/div1*
